meanings.definition: A tropical plant with starchy roots, also known as cassava.
meanings.sent1: The manioc plant grows well in warm climates.
meanings.sent2: People use manioc to make flour and tapioca.
meanings.sent3: Why did the manioc blush? Because it saw the potato peel!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a field of blooming manioc.
meanings.sent5: The farmer's hands were stained with the earthy scent of manioc.

meanings.definition: The edible starchy tuberous root of the manioc plant.
meanings.sent1: She cooked a delicious stew with manioc as the main ingredient.
meanings.sent2: The manioc root is a versatile ingredient in many dishes.
meanings.sent3: The manioc root rolled off the table and caused a comical chaos.
meanings.sent4: His determination was as strong as the fibers of a manioc root.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of boiling manioc filled the kitchen with warmth and comfort.

meanings.definition: A staple food in many tropical regions.
meanings.sent1: In some countries, manioc is a crucial part of daily meals.
meanings.sent2: The villagers harvested manioc to sustain themselves through the season.
meanings.sent3: The manioc danced in the pot, eager to be part of the delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as nourishing to the soul as manioc is to the body.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter echoed through the fields of ripe manioc plants.
